title: Consent of service
content:
Providing telemedicine services involves the use of electronic communications to allow health care providers at different locations to share individual patient medical information. The goal is to improve patient care. Providers may include primary care physicians, specialists, subspecialists, and/or other allied health care professionals. The information may be used for diagnosis, therapy, monitoring, and/or education and may include any of the following:
•	Patient medical records
•	Medical images
•	Medical test results
•	Live two-way audio and video
•	Output data from medical devices
•	Audio and video files
The electronic systems used will incorporate software and network security protocols to protect the confidentiality of patient identification and imaging data, and will include data protection and Ensuring data integrity against intentional or unintentional misconduct. Responsibility for patient care remains with the patient's local clinician, if you have one, as well as the patient's medical records.

title: Expected benefits
content: Improve access to medical care by allowing patients to stay at their local healthcare location (i.e. at home) while their doctor consults and receives test results at remote/other locations. More effective medical assessment and management. Get the expertise of a professional.

title: Possible risks:
content:
Like any medical procedure, there are potential risks associated with using telemedicine. These risks include, but may not be limited to:
- In rare cases, the consultant may determine that the information being transmitted is of inadequate quality, necessitating a face-to-face meeting with the patient or at least rescheduling the video consultation.
- Delays in medical evaluation and treatment may occur due to equipment deficiencies or failures.
- In very rare cases, security protocols may fail, resulting in a breach of privacy of personal medical information.
- In rare cases, lack of access to complete medical records may result in harmful drug interactions or allergic reactions or other errors in judgment;

By checking the box relating to 'Informed Consent,' you acknowledge that you understand and agree to the following:
• I understand that laws protecting the privacy and confidentiality of medical information also apply to telemedicine and that no information obtained through the use of telemedicine that would identify me will be disclosed to other researchers or organizations without my consent.
• I understand that I have the right to refuse or withdraw consent to use telemedicine in my care at any time without affecting my rights to future care or treatment.
• I understand the alternatives to telemedicine consultation as they have been explained to me, and in choosing to participate in telemedicine consultation, I understand that some parts of the exam involve physical examination. Substances may be administered by individuals at my location or at a testing facility, as directed by a consulting health care provider.
• I understand that telemedicine may involve electronic communication of my personal medical information with other medical practitioners who may be located in other areas, including out of state.
• I understand that I can expect expected benefits from the use of telemedicine in my care, but no results can be guaranteed or guaranteed.
• I understand that my health care information may be shared with other individuals for planning and payment purposes. Other people may also be present during the consultation in addition to my health care provider and the consulting health care provider to operate the video equipment. The persons mentioned above will keep the information obtained confidential. I further understand that I will be informed of their presence during the consultation and will therefore have the right to request the following: (1) omit specific details of the medical history/physical examination that the individual Because I feel sensitive; (2) require non-clinical staff to leave the telemedicine clinic; and/or (3) terminate consultation at any time.

title: Patient consent for the use of telemedicine
content:
I have read and understood the information provided above regarding telemedicine, discussed it with my physician or assistants who may be assigned, and all of my questions have been satisfactorily answered.
I have carefully read this document and understand the risks and benefits of a teleconference consultation and have had my questions about the procedure explained to me, and I hereby agree to participate in the telemedicine visit under the terms described herein.
By checking the box containing 'INFORMED CONSENT FOR HEALTHCARE SERVICES,' I declare that I have read, understood, and agree to the terms of this document.

title: 1. Services provided
content: HealthLine provides health care resources over the Internet to connect individuals with participating physicians, licensed therapists, and other licensed health care practitioners ('Providers') in real time, via live video conferencing, phone, and/or secure messaging to diagnose and treat patients virtually. Internet, as well as providing other types of administrative and information services ('Services'). All participating Suppliers are independent contractors. Providers may record video conference consultations, and HealthLine may record telephone calls for quality purposes. HealthLine itself does not provide any medical services or Providers.

However, you are not permitted, without our prior written permission, to frame or inline link any of the content on our Website or incorporate it into another website or translation other than any of our materials, content, or intellectual property.

Additionally, if you choose to register for specific features of the Site, such as discussion forums, blogs, photo and video sharing sites, or social networking features, you may also be asked to register with us using the form provided for other purposes, and we may ask you to provide personally identifiable information such as your name and email address. In addition, we also reserve the right to terminate the use of any username or account or deny access to the App or any feature of the App to anyone who violates these Terms of Service or who, in our sole judgment, interferes with the ability of others to enjoy our website or violates the rights of others. You agree to notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your password or account or any other breach of security and to ensure that you exit from your account after each session of use. We cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to protect your password or account information.

title: 7. Responsibility for User Provided Content
content:
The App may include various features, such as discussion forums, blogs, photo and video sharing sites, email services, and social networking features that allow feedback to us and allow users to interact with each other on the Application or to post content and materials for display on the Application. The application may also include other features, such as a personalized home page and an email service that allows users to communicate with third parties. You also grant us a license to use the materials you post or submit through the features as described in Section 2-4 above.
Responsible for the content posted on discussion forums, blogs, photo and video sharing sites, and other areas of the Site through which users can provide information or materials or submit them via any email service provided through the Site, is at the discretion of each user. You alone are responsible for the materials you post or send. We do not control messages, information, or files that you or others may transmit, post or otherwise make available on or through the Site. You understand that we have no obligation to monitor any discussion forums, blogs, photo or video sharing sites, or other areas of the Application through which users may provide information or materials. However, we always reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to screen user submissions and to edit, move, delete and/or refuse to accept any content that, in our sole judgment, is in violation of these Terms of Service or otherwise unacceptable or otherwise inappropriate, whether for legal or other reasons. You acknowledge and agree that we may preserve content and materials submitted by you and may also disclose such content and materials if required to do so by law or if, in our business judgment, such preservation or disclosure is reasonably necessary to: (a) comply with legal process; (b) enforce these Terms of Service; (c) respond to claims that any content or materials submitted by you violates the rights of third parties; or (d) protect the rights, property or personal safety of our Application, us, our affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, licensors, other users, and/or the public.

title: 8. Community rules
content:
Apps may include various features, such as discussion forums, news, photo and video sharing sites, email services, and social networking features that allow feedback to us and allow users to interact with each other on the Site and to post content and materials for display on the Site. The website may also include other features, such as a personalized home page and an email service that allows users to communicate with third parties. By accessing and using any such features, you represent and agree that you will not:
• Restrict or inhibit any other user from using and enjoying the Application.
• Use the Application to impersonate any person or entity or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent your affiliation with a person or entity
• Interfere with or disrupt any servers or networks used to provide the Application or its features, or disobey any network requirements, procedures, policies or regulations that we used to provide the Application
• Use the Application to incite or encourage others to commit illegal activities or cause injury or property damage to any person
• Gain unauthorized access to the Application or any account, computer system or network connected to the Application by means such as hacking, password mining or other illegal means
• Obtain or attempt to obtain any materials or information through any means not intentionally made available through the Application
• Use the Application to post or transmit any information that is unlawful, threatening, abusive, libelous, defamatory, obscene, vulgar, pornographic, profane or indecent of any kind, including without limitation any transmissions constituting or encouraging conduct that would constitute a criminal offense, give rise to civil liability or otherwise violate any local, state, or national law or international
• Use the Application to post or transmit any information, software or other material that violates or infringes upon the rights of others, including material that is an invasion of privacy or publicity rights or that is protected by copyright, trademark or other proprietary right or derivative material upon which to operate without first obtaining permission from the owner or rights holder
• Use the Application to post or transmit any information, software or other material that contains a virus or other harmful component
• Use the Application to post, transmit or exploit any information, software or other material for commercial purposes or that in any way contains advertising
• Use the App to advertise or solicit to anyone to buy or sell products or services or make donations of any kind without our express written consent
• Collect for marketing purposes any email addresses or other personal information that has been posted by other users of the Application
• Contact anyone who has requested not to be contacted
• Engaging in personal attacks, harassment or threats, questioning the motives behind others' posts or comments, intentionally provoking or disrupting conversations, or expressing grievances personally about other users
• Repeatedly posting the same or similar content or imposing an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on our infrastructure
• Take or request to be taken any action that disrupts the normal flow of postings and dialogue on our App (such as sending too many messages - i.e. a flooding attack) or photo negatively affect other users' ability to use the Application and/or the service; or
• Use automated means, including spiders, robots, spiders, data mining tools or similar means, to download data from our Apps. Exceptions apply to Internet search engines (e.g., Google) and non-commercial public archives (e.g., archive.org) that comply with our Terms of Service.
We reserve the right to deny access to the App or any of its features to anyone who violates these Community Rules or who, in our sole judgment, interferes with the ability of others to enjoy our App or violate the rights of others.

content: If you are a copyright owner and believe that your copyrighted material has been copied, posted or distributed through the Application in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, please notify us via e-mail to contact@healthline.vn. title: 17. HIPAA Summary Notice of Privacy Practices
content: HealthLine arranges the delivery of all physician services you can receive through your HealthLine membership. These physicians and allied health care professionals are independent practitioners, consulting, diagnosing and prescribing at their own discretion according to their individual state regulations. HealthLine does not directly provide or arrange care and does not knowingly maintain any medical information about you for the purpose of providing or supporting care. THIS NOTICE DESCRIBES HOW MEDICAL INFORMATION ABOUT YOU MAY BE USED AND DISCLOSED BY HEALTHNATION AND HOW YOU CAN GET ACCESS TO THIS INFORMATION. The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) is a federal program that requires all medical records and other individually identifiable health information used by HealthLine to used or disclosed in any form, whether electronically, on paper or orally, must be properly kept confidential. . This Act gives you, the Patient, important new rights to understand and control how your health information is used. HIPAA provides penalties for covered entities that misuse personal health information. HealthLine has prepared this “HIPAA Summary Notice of Privacy Practices” to explain how to maintain the privacy of your health information and how that information may be used and disclosed. disclose your health information. The HIPAA Notice of Privacy Practices containing a more complete description of the uses and disclosures of your health information is available to you upon request. HealthLine may use and disclose your medical records for each of the following purposes: treatment, payment and health care operations. • TREATMENT means the provision, coordination or management of health care and related services by one or more health care providers • PAYMENT means activities such as receiving payment or reimbursement for services, billing or collection activities, and usage review. • HEALTH CARE ACTIVITIES include managing your Electronic Medical Records to facilitate medical diagnostic consultations with participating physicians, as well as conduct evaluation and improvement activities improving quality, audit functions, cost management analysis and customer service. HealthLine may also create and distribute de-identified health information by removing all references to personally identifiable information. HealthLine may contact you to provide information about our services or other health-related services that may be of interest to you. Any other uses and disclosures will be made only with your written authorization. You may revoke such authorization in writing and HealthLine must honor and comply with such written request, except to the extent HealthLine has taken actions in reliance on your authorization. You have the following rights regarding your protected health information. You may exercise this right by submitting a request in writing to the HealthLine Compliance Officer, at the above address. • You have the right to request restrictions on how HealthLine uses and discloses your health information for treatment, payment and health care operations. You may also ask HealthLine to limit the release of information to people who assist in your care. HealthLine will consider your request but is not required to accept it. • You have the right to request to receive communications containing your protected health information from HealthLine by alternative means or at alternative locations. For example, you can ask HealthLine to only contact you at home or by mail. • Except in certain circumstances, you have the right to inspect and copy medical, billing, and other records used to make decisions about you. If you request a copy of this information, HealthLine may charge you a nominal fee for copying and mailing. • If you believe that information in your records is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request that we or HealthLine correct existing information or supplement missing information. In certain cases, your request may be denied, such as when the information is accurate and complete. • You have the right to receive a list of certain instances in which HealthLine has used or disclosed your medical information. If you request this information from us or from HealthLine more than once every 12 months, you may be charged a fee.
